Sentence_1.Sentence: The Antikythera mechanism is an ancient analog computer designed to predict astronomical positions and eclipses for calendrical and astrological purposes, as well as the cycles of Olympic Games.

Sentence_2.Sentence: Found housed in a 340 × 180 × 90 mm wooden box, the device is a complex clockwork mechanism composed of at least 30 meshing bronze gears.

Sentence_3.Sentence: Its remains were found as 82 separate fragments, of which only seven contain any gears or significant inscriptions.

Sentence_4.Sentence: The largest gear is approximately 140 mm in diameter.

Sentence_5.Sentence: The artifact was recovered in 1901 from the Antikythera shipwreck off the Greek island of Antikythera.

Sentence_6.Sentence: Believed to have been designed and constructed by Greek scientists, the instrument has been dated either between 150 to 100 BC or, according to a more recent view, at 205 BC.
